info.title: Murrelektronik generic REST API
info.description: Here we are doing our first steps creating our own OpenAPI

tags.name: gateway
tags.description: Access to parameters of the JSON gateway

tags.name: mqtt
tags.description: Access to the parameters of the MQTT client

tags.name: opcua
tags.description: Acces to the parametes of the OPC UA server

tags.name: slots
tags.description: Access to the parameters of the first hierarchy of the system. Layer above is the gatway.

tags.name: subslots
tags.description: Access to the parameters of the second hierarchy of the system. Layer above is the slot.

tags.name: devices
tags.description: Access to the Devices connected to the Master

tags.name: filehandling
tags.description: Access to files in an separated section on the filesystem.

tags.name: IOL_Master
tags.description: Access to parameters of the JSON IO-Link Master.

post.description: Create an new user account with credentials ect...

get.summary: Logs user into the system
get.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable.  Token is expeced in response message.

get.summary: Logs out current logged in user session
get.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable.

get.summary: Get user by name
get.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable.

put.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable.  This can only be done by the logged in user.

delete.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable.  This can only be done by the logged in user.

get.summary: Get the list of all files administrated by the filehandler
get.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable.

get.summary: Get a file administrated by the filehandler
get.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable.

delete.summary: Delete a file administrated by the filehandler
delete.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable.

post.summary: Update or create a file administrated by the filehandler
post.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable.

get.summary: Read the capabilities of the sub-module.
get.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all applications.

get.summary: Read the datastorage of the IO-Link Port.
get.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all applications. Content-string is empty if there is no datastorage content.

post.summary: Set new datastorage for IO-Link Port.
post.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable. If there are no restrictions the object will be modified. After receiving the datastorage content the port is restarted if the port is in mode Backup&Restore or Restore see also IO-Link Spec. and see 5.6.5

get.summary: Read the identification of a device connected to a subslot.
get.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable.

post.summary: Write application specific identification to a device connected to a subslot.
post.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all devices/applications where applicable.

get.summary: Read the system status of the modul.
get.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all applications.

post.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all applications.

get.summary: Read (all or selected) events from the modul.
get.description: This REST API command is mandatory for all applications.

successfulMqttPostTopic.description: Successful operation returning the topic ID

successfulFilePost.description: Successful operation returning the file id

value.message: JSON data value out of bounds
JSON data value out of range
JSON data value out of bounds
JSON data value out of range
JSON data value out of bounds
UserMgmtFailure: Maximum number of users reached.
UserMgmtFailure: User with this username already exists.

enableServer.description: This parameter is used to enable/disable the OPC UA server on the gateway

portNumber.description: Used port for OPC UA communication

writeProcessData.description: If false OPC UA server is not allowed to manipulate (write) process data.

writeAsyclicData.description: If false OPC UA server is not allowed to use the asyclic data transfer to manipulate data or configuration settings.

vendorId.description: Vendor id in an higer level organization. E.g. PI or ODVA.

productId.description: Product id in an higer level organization. E.g. PI or ODVA.

productClass.description: Classification of the product in general. E.g. device class.

name.description: Given name. E.g. name of station in PROFINET networks.

globalDiagnosticReport.description: Enables (true) or disables (false) the global diagnostic report.  If disabled no diagnostics (alarm/event) will be thrown.

undervoltageUsReport.description: Enables (true) or disables (false) undervoltage diagnostic reports of Sensor supply voltage US.  If disabled no undervoltage US diagnostics (alarm/event) will be thrown.

undervoltageUsThresold.description: Threshold with hysteresis when undervoltage US alarm/event is thrown.

undervoltageUaReport.description: Enables (true) or disables (false) undervoltage diagnostic reports of Actor supply voltage UA.  If disabled no undervoltage UA diagnostics (alarm/event) will be thrown.

undervoltageUaThresold.description: Threshold with hysteresis when undervoltage UA alarm/event is thrown.

missingUaReport.description: Enables (true) or disables (false) a missing UA diagnostic reports.  If disabled no missing UA diagnostics (alarm/event) will be thrown

diagnosticsLed.description: Enables (true) or disables (false) indication of pending diagnostics on diagnostics locked. if disabled diagnostics LED is not red even diagnostics is pending (e.g. Ua undervoltage)

ioLayoutDigitalChannels.description: IO Layout of the digital channels.  Port based: bit_0 -> port_0_pin_4, bit_1 -> port_0_pin_2, bit_2 -> port_1_pin_4, bit_3 -> port_1_pin_2, ... Pin based:  bit_0 -> port_0_pin_4, bit_1 -> port_1_pin_4, ..., bit_8 -> port_1_pin_2, bit_9 -> port_2_pin_2, ...

connected.description: True if connection to an PLC or controller is established.

name.description: Name of connected PLC or controller.

linkMau.description: Current active link of this ethernet port.

operationStatus.description: Current operation status of the module connected to this slot.

bootCycleCounter.description: Actual number of boot cycles of the module connected to this slot.

temperatures.description: Actual meassured internal temperatures of the module connected to this slot.

voltages.description: Actual meassured voltages of the module connected to this slot.

currents.description: Actual meassured currents of the module connected to this slot.

power.description: Actual power consumptions of the module connected to this slot.

operatingHours.description: Actual counted operating hours of the module connected to this slot.

example.name: operating hours since last system up

freeFlashSpace.description: Actual calculated free flash spaces sections of the module connected to this slot

subslotLegacyConnectionObject.description: This object is used if this subslot item is not configured as serial connector to a device.

subslotSerialConnectionObject.description: This object is used if this subslot item is configured as a serial connector to a device

revision.description: Mandatory if the portStatusInfo is INCORRECT_DEVICE, PREOPERATE or OPERATE.

transmissionRate.description: Mandatory if the portStatusInfo is INCORRECT_DEVICE, PREOPERATE or OPERATE.

masterCycleTime.description: Mandatory if the portStatusInfo is INCORRECT_DEVICE, PREOPERATE or OPERATE.

subslotItemObject.description: Subslot item object. If product is an IOLM: slot -> IOLM, subslot -> port, subslotItem -> pin

deviceAlias.name: deviceAlias
deviceAlias.description: Device Name configured with the subslot/configuration URL. Default Device Name is 'slotNsubslotM' where 'N' means the slotNumber and 'M' means the subslotNumber.

usernameQuery.name: username
usernameQuery.description: Query parameter username for this operation. No special characters or whitespaces are allowed for this parameter.

usernamePath.name: username
usernamePath.description: Path parameter username for this operation. No special characters or whitespaces are allowed for this parameter.

passwordQuery.name: password
passwordQuery.description: Path parameter password for this operation. Password in clear text.

mqttTopicId.name: topicId
mqttTopicId.description: ID of a configured MQTT topic. This the position of the topic in the topics list.

fileName.name: fileName
fileName.description: Filename including file extension. No special characters or whitespaces are allowed for this parameter.

EventOrigin.name: EventOrigin
EventOrigin.description: Origin/source of event: ALL(default), GATEWAY, SLOT, SUBSLOT, DEVICES

EventSlotNumber.name: EventSlotNumber
EventSlotNumber.description: Select the Slot in case of more than one. "EventSlotNumber" is only applicable with origin=SLOT and SUBSLOT

EventSubSlotNumber.name: EventSubSlotNumber
EventSubSlotNumber.description: Select the port. "EventSubSlotNumber" is only applicable with origin=SUBSLOT.

ioLinkEventDeviceAlias.name: ioLinkEventDeviceAlias
ioLinkEventDeviceAlias.description: Select a IO-Link device via alias. "ioLinkEventDeviceAlias" is only applicable with origin=DEVICES.

EventTop.name: EventTop
EventTop.description: Delivers the oldest n events of the event buffer.  "EventTop" is mutually exclusive to "EventBottom".

EventBottom.name: EventBottom
EventBottom.description: Delivers the oldest n events of the event buffer.  "EventBottom" is mutually exclusive to "EventTop".

bearerAuth.description: note: non-oauth scopes are not defined at the securityScheme level

value.text: FET outputvoltage should be low, but high voltage is meassured!
